title: Missing CSRF protection
description:
**Location:** src/server/index.ts:62-75

**Issue:** No CSRF token validation exists on state-changing operations (POST, PUT, DELETE). Additionally, localStorage auth tokens are readable by any script on the page, making them vulnerable to XSS attacks.

**Impact:** Medium-High - Attackers could trick authenticated users into performing unwanted actions via malicious websites or scripts.

**Fix:**
- Implement CSRF token generation and validation for all state-changing operations
- Consider moving auth tokens to httpOnly cookies instead of localStorage
- Add SameSite cookie attribute for additional protection
- Validate Origin/Referer headers as defense in depth
close_reason: Added CSRF middleware that validates Origin header for state-changing requests (POST/PUT/DELETE/PATCH). Allows same-origin, configured CORS origins, and API-authenticated requests.

**Impact:** Medium - An authenticated attacker could disable authentication or modify security settings to gain persistent access.

**Fix:**
- Define an explicit allowlist of settings that can be updated through the bulk endpoint
- Reject any attempts to update auth/security-related settings through this endpoint
- Create separate, privileged endpoints for modifying security settings
- Log attempts to modify protected settings

title: Rate limiting bypassed via fake headers
description:

**Fix:** 
- Only trust proxy headers when the application is configured to run behind a known reverse proxy
- Validate that requests actually come from trusted proxy IP addresses
- Consider using a configurable 'trust proxy' setting
- Fall back to direct connection IP when proxy headers are untrusted

title: Replace `any` types with `unknown` in logger utility
description:
## Issue

The logger utility uses `any` type for data parameters, which defeats TypeScript type safety.

## Locations

- src/server/utils/logger.ts:7,44,78,106,133,137,141,145

## Current Code

```typescript
// Multiple instances of:
data?: any
```

## Fix

Use `unknown` type instead of `any` to maintain type safety while allowing any data to be passed:

```typescript
data?: unknown
```

This forces callers to properly type-check the data before using it, while still allowing flexible logging.

**Issue:** The /system/skip-setup endpoint allows ANY unauthenticated user to bypass the setup wizard. This is a critical security vulnerability as it could allow attackers to skip authentication setup entirely.

**Impact:** Critical - An attacker could bypass the entire setup/authentication flow.

**Fix:** Require authentication or implement a one-time token mechanism for the skip-setup endpoint. Consider:
- Only allow skip-setup during initial setup (before any users exist)
- Require a valid admin authentication token
- Use a time-limited, single-use token generated during setup
close_reason: Added defense-in-depth checks: blocks if auth enabled, setup already skipped, or setup already complete

title: Refactor Setup.tsx - extract components
Migrate existing library_path to libraries table
description: Create migration that: 1) Creates libraries table, 2) Migrates existing library_path setting to first library entry, 3) Updates existing games with libraryId, 4) Updates libraryFiles with libraryId.
close_reason: Auto-migration added to server startup in index.ts. Build verified successfully.

title: Add unique constraint on downloadHistory.downloadId
description:
The downloadId field in downloadHistory table represents a unique identifier (torrent hash) but lacks a unique constraint. This could allow duplicate entries.

Fix: Add .unique() constraint to downloadId field in schema.ts

title: Implement or document incomplete TODO in cancelDownload
description:
## Issue

There is a TODO comment in cancelDownload that indicates incomplete implementation for updating release status in the database.

## Location

- src/server/services/DownloadService.ts:563

## Current Code

```typescript
// TODO: Update release status in database
```

## Fix

Either:

1. **Implement the status update:**
```typescript
await this.releaseRepository.updateStatus(releaseId, 'failed');
// or 'cancelled' if that status exists
```

2. **Document why it's deferred:**
```typescript
// Note: Release status update handled by DownloadMonitor on next sync
// to avoid race conditions with concurrent status checks
```

The appropriate fix depends on the intended behavior - investigate whether the DownloadMonitor already handles this case.

title: Fix improper HTTP method usage in routes
description:
Several endpoints use wrong HTTP methods:
- POST /games/:id/toggle-monitor - should be PATCH (update)
- POST /games/:id/rematch - should be PATCH (update)
- POST /search/releases/:id - should be GET (read-only search)
- GET /updates/check - should be POST (triggers action)

Fix: Change to appropriate HTTP methods.

title: Extract duplicate utility functions from pages
description:
formatBytes() and formatDate() are duplicated across multiple pages:

- formatBytes: Activity.tsx, Search.tsx, Updates.tsx
- formatDate: Search.tsx, Updates.tsx, Discover.tsx, Library.tsx

Fix: Extract to src/web/src/utils/formatters.ts and import where needed.

title: Add pagination to list endpoints

List endpoints return all records without pagination:
- GET /api/v1/games - returns all games
- GET /api/v1/library/scan - returns all folders
- GET /api/v1/indexers/torrents - up to 100 torrents
- GET /api/v1/discover/popular - up to 100 games

Fix: Add page/limit query params and return pagination metadata.

title: IGDBClient should use custom IGDBError class

IGDBClient throws generic Error objects (lines 39, 56, 67, 88, 230, 274, 303) instead of using IGDBError from the project's error utilities. The IGDBError class exists but is never used.

Fix: Import IGDBError and ErrorCode, replace all generic Error throws with IGDBError using specific codes.

title: Sequential auto-matching with delay in Library
description:
**Location:** src/web/src/pages/Library.tsx:242-294

**Issue:** For 100 unmatched folders, takes ~30 seconds minimum (100 * 300ms delay)

**Fix:** Use Promise.all with concurrency limit to process 5-10 folders in parallel

Replace any types in API client

api/client.ts uses 'any' type for parameters:

- updateGame(id, game: any) line 49

title: Add logging to empty catch blocks

Different modals use different opacity values:

- GameSelectionModal: bg-opacity-90
- MatchFolderModal: bg-opacity-95
- SearchReleasesModal: bg-opacity-95
- AddGameModal: bg-opacity-95

title: Add Zod validation to remaining routes
description:
Some routes use @hono/zod-validator (games.ts, updates.ts) but others manually validate (search.ts, settings.ts, library.ts, downloads.ts, steam.ts).

Fix: Migrate all POST/PUT routes to use Zod schemas for type-safe validation.

title: Add rate limiting to API endpoints
description:
No rate limiting on any endpoints. Vulnerable to:
- Brute force attacks
- Resource exhaustion via library scans
- API quota exhaustion (IGDB, Prowlarr)

Critical endpoints:
- /api/v1/steam/import-stream
- /api/v1/library/scan
- /api/v1/search/*

Fix: Add rate limiting middleware (e.g., hono-rate-limiter).

title: Add logging to SteamClient
description:
SteamClient doesn't import or use the project's logger utility while all other integration clients (IGDBClient, ProwlarrClient, QBittorrentClient) consistently use logger.info() and logger.error().

Fix: Import logger and add logging statements for connection tests, API calls, and errors.

title: Create missing DownloadHistoryRepository
description:
The downloadHistory table is defined in schema.ts but there is no corresponding DownloadHistoryRepository. DownloadService.ts imports downloadHistory table directly, violating CLAUDE.md architecture rules.

Fix: Create src/server/repositories/DownloadHistoryRepository.ts with standard CRUD operations.

title: Fix N+1 query in DownloadService.syncDownloadStatus
description:
Individual database queries inside loop for each active release (lines 223-261). With 20 downloads, generates 40+ queries every 30 seconds.

Fix: Batch updates using transactions or bulk update operations.

title: Lazy load Settings tabs
description:
Settings.tsx loads all 14 settings in parallel on mount (lines 74-104). Settings for inactive tabs shouldn't load until needed.

Fix: Load settings per tab when tab becomes active.

title: Automatic game matching

title: Add Libraries settings tab in frontend
description: New tab in Settings page for managing libraries. List view with add/edit/delete. Each library has name, path (with folder picker), platform dropdown, monitored toggle. Replace single library_path input.
close_reason: Created LibrariesTab component with full CRUD UI. Added API client methods for libraries. Build verified.

title: Fix N+1 query in FileService.findDuplicateGames
description:
O(n¬≤) nested loops with blocking filesystem operations in FileService.findDuplicateGames() (lines 680-748). With 100 games, causes up to 4,950 iterations with blocking I/O.

getFolderSize() inside nested loop uses fs.statSync/fs.readdirSync which blocks event loop.

Fix: Pre-calculate folder sizes before comparison loop, use async fs operations.

title: Add section icons to Settings page headers
description: Settings page sections (Prowlarr, IGDB, qBittorrent, etc.) lack visual hierarchy. Add appropriate icons to each section header to improve scannability.

title: Retry logic for failed downloads
description: Add retry logic to automatically retry failed downloads with exponential backoff

title: Convert FileService to async file operations
description:
FileService uses synchronous file system operations (fs.statSync, fs.readdirSync, fs.renameSync) which block the event loop during large folder operations.

Affected lines: 108-136, 217-245

Fix: Use async/await versions (fs.promises.stat, fs.promises.readdir, fs.promises.rename) throughout the service.

title: Mobile responsive UI overhaul
description: Complete mobile responsive implementation for all pages. Tables become cards, forms stack vertically, modals go full-screen, touch targets are 44px+. Activity page pattern (ActivityMobileView + ActivityTable with md:hidden/hidden md:block) serves as the template.

title: Add rate limiting and retry logic to integration clients
description:
No integration clients implement retry logic for transient failures or rate limiting.

IGDB has rate limits (4 req/sec) but no actual rate limiting code exists.
All clients make single fetch attempts with no retry.

Fix: Implement exponential backoff retry for 5xx/timeout errors. Add rate limiting for IGDB.

title: Fix App.tsx NavLink inline function re-renders

Arrow functions in NavLink className prop create new instances on every render (lines 27-92).

Fix: Extract to useCallback or external function.

Activity.tsx useEffect (lines 65-72) sets up polling interval with empty dependency array. loadDownloads isn't wrapped in useCallback, causing potential memory leak.

title: Library page loads all tabs on mount
description:
**Location:** src/web/src/pages/Library.tsx:224-239

**Issue:** Every visit loads scan data AND health data regardless of which tab user views

**Fix:** Lazy-load tabs - only load data when respective tab is clicked

title: Replace `any` types in SettingsRepository and Zod schema
description:
## Issue

The SettingsRepository and library route use `any` types which bypass TypeScript type safety.

## Locations

- src/server/repositories/SettingsRepository.ts:60 - setJSON accepts `any`
- src/server/routes/library.ts:31 - Zod schema uses z.any() for platforms

## Fix

### SettingsRepository
Use a generic type constraint:
```typescript
async setJSON<T extends Record<string, unknown>>(key: string, value: T): Promise<void>
```

### Zod Schema
Define proper validation for platforms:
```typescript
platforms: z.array(z.object({
  id: z.number(),
  name: z.string()
})).optional()
```
